newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish bourse starts extended trading hours.
newsitem.headline: Swedish bourse starts extended trading hours.

text.p: Sweden's stock market on Monday extends its trading hours, staying open for an hour longer.
A spokeswoman from the exchange said the new trading hours for shares and convertible bonds was 0800 GMT until 1500 GMT.
Market hours for bonds remained unchanged at 0730-1400 GMT and for premium bonds at 0730-1300 GMT.
The spokeswoman said a major reason for the new hours was that previously the Swedish bourse was only open for 30 minutes for trading after Wall Street's opening.
